plants.name: Prunus serrulata
plants.description: A deciduous tree known for its beautiful and abundant pink or white flowers that herald the arrival of spring in Japan and many other temperate regions.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late March to early April (varies by location, some early blooms in late February or early March)
plants.location: Japan, temperate regions of North America and Europe
plants.funFact: The timing of cherry blossom blooming is celebrated annually in Japan with 'Hanami' festivals, symbolizing the transient nature of life.

plants.name: Narcissus pseudonarcissus
plants.description: A perennial bulbous plant producing bright yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers in early spring, often found in woodlands and meadows.
plants.location: Western and Central Europe, naturalized in parts of North America
plants.funFact: Daffodils are known to contain toxic compounds which help deter pests and herbivores.

plants.name: Acacia pycnantha
plants.description: Australia's national floral emblem, this shrub or small tree produces vibrant yellow fluffy flower clusters that bloom in late winter to early spring.
plants.bloomingSeason: June to September in southern hemisphere (approaching early spring), some early blooms in March in certain areas
plants.funFact: Golden Wattle flowers are rich in nectar and an important food source for native pollinators.

plants.name: Magnolia stellata
plants.description: A small deciduous tree notable for its large, fragrant star-shaped white or pink flowers that bloom very early in spring, often before the leaves appear.
plants.location: Japan, cultivated widely in temperate regions globally
plants.funFact: Star magnolia flowers have numerous narrow petals (tepals), typically between 12 and 18, which create a distinctive star-like shape.
